sentence.Network_en: It is true that colonialism did not bequeath much to Africa.
sentence.Network_cn: 殖民主义给非洲确实没有留下多少东西。

sentence.Network_en: She said if the world did not act conclusively now, it would only bequeath the problem to future generations.
sentence.Network_cn: 她说如果人类现在不采取决定性的行动，那就只会把问题留给子孙后代。

sentence.Network_en: It will be better to bequeath it to him after my death, in my will.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不如写在遗嘱里,等我死了留赠给他.

this unwieldy archive of my past , all my nearly forgotten selves , will eventually be my bequeathed burden to her , I suppose .我这些繁重的过往以及几乎已被遗忘的自己，我觉得最终将会是她继承的负担。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  becwethan, from be- 'about' (expressing transitivity) + cwethan 'say' (see quoth)

entry.def: If you bequeath your money or property to someone, you legally state that they should have it when you die.

example.ex: Fields's will bequeathed his wife Hattie and son Claude the sum of twenty thousand dollars...
example.tran: 菲尔茨将遗赠给他妻子哈蒂和儿子克劳德共计两万美元。

example.ex: He bequeathed all his silver to his children.
example.tran: 他把他所有的钱财都留给了孩子。

entry.def: If you bequeath an idea or system, you leave it for other people to use or develop.

example.ex: He bequeaths his successor an economy that is doing quite well...
example.tran: 他给继任者留下了发展势头非常不错的经济。

example.ex: It is true that colonialism did not bequeath much to Africa.
example.tran: 殖民主义给非洲确实没有留下多少东西。

means.word_mean: 1. leave or give by will after one's death;

sentences.sentence: "My aunt bequeathed me all her jewelry"
"My grandfather left me his entire estate"

auth_sentence.content: This is the nightmare that the next elections could bequeath to India.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is the nightmare that the next elections could bequeath to India.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is the nightmare that the next elections could bequeath to India.

auth_sentence.content: Wilt thou forsake thy fortune, Bequeath thy land to him and follow me?
auth_sentence.res_content: Wilt thou forsake thy fortune, Bequeath thy land to him and follow me?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wilt thou forsake thy fortune, Bequeath thy land to him and follow me?

auth_sentence.content: Don't let us bequeath to our successors the appalling shambles that London Underground has been allowed to become.
auth_sentence.res_content: Don't let us bequeath to our successors the appalling shambles that London Underground has been allowed to become.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Don't let us bequeath to our successors the appalling shambles that London Underground has been allowed to become.

sentences.en: His father bequeathed him a big fortune.
sentences.cn: 他父亲给他留下了一大笔遗产。
